What is the main objective of Perception Rolls in Call of Cthulhu?
To gather information and solve mysteries

What are the three main perception skills in Call of Cthulhu?
Spot Hidden, Spot Normal, and Spot Other

What can Perception Rolls be used for in Call of Cthulhu?
Chiefly visual observation, though it can also be used for smell or taste

What is the primary benefit of having a good grasp of events in Call of Cthulhu?
Providing a reliable answer to unanticipated questions

Chiefly visual observation

What can you provide if you have a good grasp of how events unfolded?
A reliable answer, even to unanticipated questions.

What are the three main perception skills in Call of Cthulhu?
Spot Hidden, Listen, and Psychology.

What happens if a player succeeds in a roll for a perception skill?
Some information pertinent to the scenario should be forthcoming.

Who usually asks for perception rolls?
The Keeper.

Why might a player request a perception roll?
If their investigator is actively searching for a clue.

What is the main goal for investigators in the game?
to find out what is happening

What is the purpose of important information in the game?
to point the investigators in the right direction

How are clues divided in the game?
into obvious clues and obscure clues
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the purpose of the Keeper in the game?
to try to prevent the players from finding the key to the whole adventure

What is the Idea roll used for if investigators miss a clue?
to fall back on
You are a helpful assistant.
What are obvious clues?
Obvious clues are clues that you decide, useful if your game is plot-driven, especially when missing such a clue would leave the players at a loss for how to proceed.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the purpose of obvious clues?
The players are not required to roll dice to uncover obvious clues.
You are a helpful assistant.
What are the characteristics of obscured clues?
There may be obvious clues and obscured clues at the same location.
You are a helpful assistant.
What makes an item an obscured clue?
It might be obvious that a book has been moved by the dust marks on the desk, but the single blonde hair lying in the dust might go unnoticed.
You are a helpful assistant.
Why are obvious clues useful?
They are useful if your game is plot-driven, especially when missing such a clue would leave the players at a loss for how to proceed.
You are a helpful assistant.
Who decides who gets the obscured clue?
The Keeper, perhaps the player who has been least actively involved in the game, or the player of the investigator with the highest Spot Hidden score.
You are a helpful assistant.
What are the investigators searching for in the town?
A cultist

Where does the scene take place, according to the Keeper?
A haunted house

Why might the single blonde hair be overlooked?
It might go unnoticed, especially if it is at the same location as other clues.

What is the Keeper preparing for the investigators?
A cool scene
